author: John Falkenberg
title: Tyler Perry Says Backlash over All-White Cast Is “Reverse Racism”
text:
Black Actor Called Bigot After Sending Out Christmas Card with Inside Joke in Picture 
“That’s totally reverse racism, because it was coming from African-American people,” said Perry, according to Fox News . 
“I don’t know if it was because (the critics) thought I should only be giving jobs to black people. Well, I think that’s ridiculous,” he continued. “If you look at the hundreds of black people I’ve given jobs to and even the ones I’ve made millionaires, people of color, I just think it’s unfair.” 
According to Perry, the more he travels and interacts with people, the less he sees color. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I’m just finding out more as I travel the country and world, the more I meet people, we’re all the same,” Perry said. “We all got the same dramas. So I’m not seeing color as much as I did anymore in the sense of our stories. Our stories are so similar.” 
Our stories are similar, and understanding that people are people everywhere is essential not only to casting decisions but to interacting with people in any field.
